title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 22 october [1867]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 22 October [1867]
text: 22 Oct. 186722 OctoberWell Walter my deari have just received your welcome letter with the 10 dollersdollars all safe this time any how but the lastslast weeksweek's one is gone shuresure i wouldentwouldn't be so worried for a trifle i tell you i have surmised every thing that was possible for an old granny to summisesurmise i have read over the last letter you sent the 8th every hour or so) i had ought to have got this yesterday but i was thankfullthankful to get it to daytoday where doodo you have an idea the letter and money was taken i am inclined somewhat to think it never come to brooklynBrooklyn but somebody got it O walt if you had only come last week but you must come about cristmasChristmas any how i thought you was sick and i fretted but its all past now and i think i wontwon't be so foolish again but i suppose i should if any thing of the kind occuredoccurred the Doctor has just been in to see me he says if this medicine dontdon't help me he dontdon't know as any thing will sometimes i think it will help me my appetite is better and i feel stronger than i did before i took it) matty and sis is here as usual hattie goes to school and improves very much in her studies and looks matt has just had a letter from Jeff he dontdon't say when he shall come but i suppose when he can) have you heard from the galaxyGalaxy man how he feels about it if it meets his approbation i dontdon't know as you can spell out this letter Walter write all about every thing you can think ofgood bie walter dearLW Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 22 October [1867]
